advantage.name: Odious personal habit
advantage.description: The character has a disgusting habit which others find repulsive. It could be continuous humming (one point), continuous swearing or nose picking (two points) or habits which should never ever be done in public (four points). This disadvantage will give big penalties in social situations, especially where good behaviour is expected. A temperence roll of difficulty 30 is needed to avoid doing it.

advantage.name: Pyromania
advantage.description: The character is a pyromaniac, having an unhealthy love of fires. It is difficult to resist the temptation of setting a fire if the opportunity arises.

description.para: Someone with a sense of duty feels bound to aid a certain type of person, or an organisation. His motivation is purely selfless, though may be through a sense of guilt or gratitude.

A sense of duty towards a small group of people (such as close friends or family) is worth two points, towards a larger group (tribe, relatives, guild) four points, and to an entire nation or religion, is six points.

The character does not like to break the law, however stupid the law may be, or however inconvenient it is. If persuaded to break the law (through action or inaction), then they will feel very guilty, and worry about being caught etc for a long time.

The sadist gains pleasure from the physical or metal anguish of others. They inflict pain on others simply because it makes them feel good. They may even go out of their way to hurt someone, and may prefer to leave enemies alive, minus a limb or two, rather than kill them.
The character thinks too highly of himself and his friends, and tends to over estimate their competence on a regular basis.
The character has a compulsion or habit which she has to indulge in on a regular basis. A compulsion might be to wash very regularly, argue about anything, gambling etc.
A fantatic is completely devoted to a cause, and will lay down their life for that cause if necessary.
A delusional character believes strongly in something that just isn't true.
A lazy person will try their best to avoid work whenever possible.

A glutton loves to eat, far more than he actually needs to. Unlike vorocious appetite, a glutton won't suffer if he goes without an extra large portion of food, though he may believe that he will, and everybody else will suffer his complaints.
A greedy person loves money and wealth.
A code of honour is a set of guiding principles which the character sets his life by.

targetlist.entry: Always avenge an insult, stand up for your friends.
Don't change sides after accepting payment, don't abandon your lord. Always accept surrender, and give a fair ransom - one day it might be you.
Live by the code of chivalry.
